thread.title: Area football: Balanced North Mac rolls to 7th straight
thread.title_full: Area football: Balanced North Mac rolls to 7th straight

author: Staff report
title: Area football: Balanced North Mac rolls to 7th straight
text: Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 12:22 AM By Staff report Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 12:22 AM VIRDEN — Asa Donaldson scored three touchdowns and had 91 yards receiving and 83 yards rushing Friday night, leading state-ranked North Mac High School to a 62-14 Sangamo Conference rout of Riverton. The Panthers, No. 7 in The Associated Press Class 3A, poll improved to 7-0 overall and in the Sangamo. Brennan White completed 13 of 15 passes for 162 yards with one interception and two touchdowns for North Mack. He also had 111 rushing yards and a touchdown on 12 carries and eight extra-point kicks. Kendall Bearden led North Mac with 128 rushing yards on nine carries. The Panthers had seven sacks and held Riverton to negative rushing yards. The Hawks rushed 17 times for negative-91 yards. Riverton’s Kyle Hogan passed for 258 yards and completed 12 of 27 passes. He had one interception and one touchdown. Keegan Ramsey had a receiving touchdown for the Hawks (1-6, 1-5). PLEASANT PLAINS 48, PITTSFIELD 7: At Pleasant Plains, Nik Georges totaling 231 yards on 20 carries and scored five touchdowns to lead the Cardinals in the Samgamo Conference romp. Korbyn Personett scored Pittsfield’s lone touchdown on a 1-yard run. Cole Greer caught a touchdown pass for Pleasant Plains, 4-3 overall and 4-2 in the Sangamo. Pleasant Plains had 455 rushing yards. Pittsfield’s Quinn Leahy threw for 178 yards and a touchdown as the Saukees fell to 1-6. WILLIAMSVILLE 49, PETERSBURG PORTA 6: At Williamsville, Jace Franklin totaled for 130 yards on 10 carries and two touchdowns to lead the Bullets. Williamsville (4-3 overall and 3-3 in the Sangamo) had 345 rushing yards and six touchdowns on the ground. Connor Icenogle recorded 95 yards on only three carries, one of which was a 68-yard rushing touchdown. PORTA’s Sam Wenda was the top performer for the Bluejays, throwing for 130 yards on 22 attempts. Brandon Allison, who rushed for 53 yards on 16 carries, scored PORTA’s only touchdown on a 6-yard run in the third period. The Bluejays are 0-7 overall and 0-6 in league games. NEW BERLIN 34, ATHENS 27: At New Berlin, the Pretzels rallied with 14 unanswered points and Connor Burger scored the go-ahead touchdown on a 48-yard run with 10 minutes 46 seconds remaining in the fourth quarter to five the Pretzels the Sangamo Conference win. Matthew Selinger’s 31-yard interception return and a kick by Drayton Davis with 2:48 left in the third quarter put Athens ahead 27-20. New Berlin answered when Hunter Stockton found Burger for a 39-yard halfback pass completion with 24 seconds remaining in the quarter. Athens led 27-26 after New Berlin’s kick was blocked. Athens went three-and-out, then Burger scored the winning touchdown on the first play of next drive. Burger finished with four touchdowns, 124 receiving yards and six catches. New Berlin’s Cam Cummings completed 13 of 19 passes for 171 yards and had two interceptions. Page 2 of 3 - The Pretzels (6-1 overall, 6-1 in the Sangamo) clinched their third straight playoff berth. New Berlin has won six consecutive games after a loss to North Mac in its opener. Nathan Shaffer had 90 rushing yards and a touchdown for Athens (3-4, 3-3). Hunter Maxwell rushed for 81 yards and two touchdowns. TAYLORVILLE 43, CHARLESTON 17: At Charleston, the Class 4A 10th-ranked Tornadoes improved to 7-0 overall and 4-0 in the Apollo Conference. Tyler Gist had two rushing touchdowns for Taylorville and 74 yards on 10 attempts. Louis DePaepe had a touchdown and 70 rushing yards on six carries. Brett Langen had two sacks for the Tornadoes. CARLINVILLE 42, HILLSBORO 19: At Carlinville, Jacob Dixon recorded 216 yards and five touchdowns to lift the Cavaliers to the South Central Conference victory. That brought Dixon’s season totals to 1,348 yards and 21 rushing touchdowns. Hillsboro’s Caleb Jackson recorded 135 yards and two touchdowns on 31 carries for the Hiltoppers, raising his season totals to 1,119 yards and 16 touchdowns. Carlinville’s defense recorded two interceptions and recovered two fumbles. Carlinville improved to 5-2 and Hillsboro fell to 4-3. PANA 35, LITCHFIELD 7: At Pana, the Panthers led 35-0 after three periods and remained unbeaten in the South Central Conference. Pana, ranked No. 7 in this week’s Associated Press Class 2A poll, improved to 7-0. Adam Miller opened Pana’s scoring with a 30-yard TD interception return and Rhett Zahradka (eight carries for 76 yards) made it 13-0 at the half when he ran 47 yards for a TD. Wade McMillen added two rushing TDs in the second half and finished with 97 yards on 13 attempts. Ian Harbert also had a 5-yard TD run as Pana ended with 271 total rushing yards. Litchfield managed 128 yards of total offense, with 113 coming on the ground. Litchfield’s only score was a 40-yard fumble return by Josh Franke off a Pana botched snap. PAWNEE 42, EAST ALTON-WOOD RIVER 0: At Wood River, Austin Galloway ran for three touchdowns to lead Pawnee to its sixth win. Galloway had rushing scores of 1, 15 and 42 yards and gained 115 yards on 12 attempts. Galloway also caught a 39-yard TD pass from quarterback Dane Moats and finished with 58 receiving yards. Kolton Behrent finished the scoring with a 1-yard TD run in the third quarter for Pawnee (6-1). MOUNT OLIVE 47, METRO EAST LUTHERAN 20: At Mount Olive, quarterback Andrew Jones rushed for two scores and threw for three others to keep the Wildcats playoffs hope alive. Mount Olive improved to 4-3 with two regular-season games remaining. Jones had rushing scores of 1 and 3 yards. His three pass completions went for scores — one TD to Nick DeVries — and the other two to Ethan Swenson. Mount Olive led winless Metro East 32-0 at the half. Page 3 of 3 - Jonathan Darrah, who scored a 1-yard TD, finished with 20 carries for 154 yards. Jones rushed 27 times for 121 yards as the Wildcats gained 330 total yards on the ground. Logan Scheiter added a 30-yard TD run in the fourth period and he finished with 10 tackles defensively. RUSHVILLE-INDUSTRY 27, ASTORIA SOUTH FULTON 0: At Rushville, Christian Downs threw for two touchdowns and ran for one other as the Rockets blanked South Fulton. The win made Rushville-Industry playoff eligible as the Rockets improved to 5-2. Downs completed four of four passes for 79 yards and his two passing TDs went to Colton Boyd, who finished with 38 yards receiving. Downs rushed nine times and finished with 111 yards. Ethan Downs also scored a TD and gained 58 yards on 11 carries. ARCOLA 42, NIANTIC SANGAMON VALLEY 0: At Niantic, the host team suffered its first loss of the season and had just 103 yards of total offense against Arcola, No. 2 in the Class 3A Associated Press state poll. Wyatt Beals led Sangamon Valley with 22 rushing yards on seven carries in the Little Okaw Valley Conference Northwest Division game. Nathan Highley rushed for 15 yards on one attempt. The Storm’s Miles Hutchins threw two interceptions and completed five of 15 passes for 47 yards. Mason Hutchins led with 19 receiving yards on one catch. Sangamon Valley falls to 6-1 overall and 3-1 in the conference. Arcola is 7-0. By Staff report
